project_abstract.cdata: The Emergency Transport and Rehabilitation Project for Afghanistan's development objective is to facilitate the country's economic and social recovery through improved physical access to goods, markets, and administrative and social services. This will be achieved by: a) removing key transport bottlenecks that hamper recovery; b) building capacity in management, implementation and maintenance of transport services and works through the provision of equipment and technical assistance related to planning, maintenance, and supervision of works; and c) assisting in the establishment of a policy framework for sustainable service delivery in the transport sector. The project consist of four components: 1) rehabilitation and renovation of existing highways; 2) civil aviation: emergency repairs, rehabilitation and reconstruction of damaged main airport runway pavement and provision and training of communications and traffic control equipment; 3) rehabilitation of selected secondary and tertiary roads serving the rural population; 4) assistance for a sustainable management of the transport sector by development of a Transport Sector Review (TSR) to develop an Institutional and Policy Framework. In conclusion, the civil works and subsequent maintenance services financed through the project will provide opportunity for employment through the engagement of the local population in rehabilitation activities.
